properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

CloudExadataInfrastructureId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an ARM resource.

CloudExadataInfrastructureListResult.description: The response of a CloudExadataInfrastructure list operation.

value.description: The CloudExadataInfrastructure items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

computeCount.description: The number of compute servers for the cloud Exadata infrastructure.

storageCount.description: The number of storage servers for the cloud Exadata infrastructure.

totalStorageSizeInGbs.description: The total storage allocated to the cloud Exadata infrastructure resource, in gigabytes (GB).

availableStorageSizeInGbs.description: The available storage can be allocated to the cloud Exadata infrastructure resource, in gigabytes (GB).

timeCreated.description: The date and time the cloud Exadata infrastructure resource was created.

lifecycleDetails.description: Additional information about the current lifecycle state.

estimatedPatchingTime.description: The estimated total time required in minutes for all patching operations (database server, storage server, and network switch patching).

customerContacts.description: The list of customer email addresses that receive information from Oracle about the specified OCI Database service resource. Oracle uses these email addresses to send notifications about planned and unplanned software maintenance updates, information about system hardware, and other information needed by administrators. Up to 10 email addresses can be added to the customer contacts for a cloud Exadata infrastructure instance.

shape.description: The model name of the cloud Exadata infrastructure resource.

ociUrl.description: HTTPS link to OCI resources exposed to Azure Customer via Azure Interface.

cpuCount.description: The total number of CPU cores allocated.

maxCpuCount.description: The total number of CPU cores available.

maxMemoryInGbs.description: The total memory available in GBs.

dbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The local node storage to be allocated in GBs.

maxDbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The total local node storage available in GBs.

dataStorageSizeInTbs.description: The quantity of data in the database, in terabytes.

maxDataStorageInTbs.description: The total available DATA disk group size.

dbServerVersion.description: The software version of the database servers (dom0) in the Exadata infrastructure.

storageServerVersion.description: The software version of the storage servers (cells) in the Exadata infrastructure.

activatedStorageCount.description: The requested number of additional storage servers activated for the Exadata infrastructure.

additionalStorageCount.description: The requested number of additional storage servers for the Exadata infrastructure.

displayName.description: The name for the Exadata infrastructure.

lastMaintenanceRunId.description: The OCID of the last maintenance run.

nextMaintenanceRunId.description: The OCID of the next maintenance run.

CloudExadataInfrastructureUpdate.description: The type used for update operations of the CloudExadataInfrastructure.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

CloudVmClusterListResult.description: The response of a CloudVmCluster list operation.

value.description: The CloudVmCluster items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

listenerPort.description: The port number configured for the listener on the cloud VM cluster.

nodeCount.description: The number of nodes in the cloud VM cluster.

storageSizeInGbs.description: The data disk group size to be allocated in GBs per VM.

dataStorageSizeInTbs.description: The data disk group size to be allocated in TBs.

dbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The local node storage to be allocated in GBs.

memorySizeInGbs.description: The memory to be allocated in GBs.

timeCreated.description: The date and time that the cloud VM cluster was created.

lifecycleDetails.description: Additional information about the current lifecycle state.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the cloud VM cluster. For details, see [Exadata Infrastructure Time Zones](/Content/Database/References/timezones.htm).

zoneId.description: The OCID of the zone the cloud VM cluster is associated with.

hostname.description: The hostname for the cloud VM cluster.

domain.description: The domain name for the cloud VM cluster.

cpuCoreCount.description: The number of CPU cores enabled on the cloud VM cluster.

ocpuCount.description: The number of OCPU cores to enable on the cloud VM cluster. Only 1 decimal place is allowed for the fractional part.

clusterName.description: The cluster name for cloud VM cluster. The cluster name must begin with an alphabetic character, and may contain hyphens (-). Underscores (_) are not permitted. The cluster name can be no longer than 11 characters and is not case sensitive.

dataStoragePercentage.description: The percentage assigned to DATA storage (user data and database files). The remaining percentage is assigned to RECO storage (database redo logs, archive logs, and recovery manager backups). Accepted values are 35, 40, 60 and 80. The default is 80 percent assigned to DATA storage. See [Storage Configuration](/Content/Database/Concepts/exaoverview.htm#Exadata) in the Exadata documentation for details on the impact of the configuration settings on storage.

isLocalBackupEnabled.description: If true, database backup on local Exadata storage is configured for the cloud VM cluster. If false, database backup on local Exadata storage is not available in the cloud VM cluster.

isSparseDiskgroupEnabled.description: If true, sparse disk group is configured for the cloud VM cluster. If false, sparse disk group is not created.

systemVersion.description: Operating system version of the image.

sshPublicKeys.description: The public key portion of one or more key pairs used for SSH access to the cloud VM cluster.

licenseModel.description: The Oracle license model that applies to the cloud VM cluster. The default is LICENSE_INCLUDED.

diskRedundancy.description: The type of redundancy configured for the cloud Vm cluster. NORMAL is 2-way redundancy. HIGH is 3-way redundancy.

scanIpIds.description: The Single Client Access Name (SCAN) IP addresses associated with the cloud VM cluster. SCAN IP addresses are typically used for load balancing and are not assigned to any interface. Oracle Clusterware directs the requests to the appropriate nodes in the cluster.  **Note:** For a single-node DB system, this list is empty.

vipIds.description: The virtual IP (VIP) addresses associated with the cloud VM cluster. The Cluster Ready Services (CRS) creates and maintains one VIP address for each node in the Exadata Cloud Service instance to enable failover. If one node fails, the VIP is reassigned to another active node in the cluster.  **Note:** For a single-node DB system, this list is empty.

scanDnsName.description: The FQDN of the DNS record for the SCAN IP addresses that are associated with the cloud VM cluster.

scanListenerPortTcp.description: The TCP Single Client Access Name (SCAN) port. The default port is 1521.

scanListenerPortTcpSsl.description: The TCPS Single Client Access Name (SCAN) port. The default port is 2484.

scanDnsRecordId.description: The OCID of the DNS record for the SCAN IP addresses that are associated with the cloud VM cluster.

shape.description: The model name of the Exadata hardware running the cloud VM cluster.

ociUrl.description: HTTPS link to OCI resources exposed to Azure Customer via Azure Interface.

backupSubnetCidr.description: Client OCI backup subnet CIDR, default is 192.168.252.0/22

dataCollectionOptions.description: Indicates user preferences for the various diagnostic collection options for the VM cluster/Cloud VM cluster/VMBM DBCS.

computeNodes.description: The list of compute servers to be added to the cloud VM cluster.

iormConfigCache.description: iormConfigCache details for cloud VM cluster.

lastUpdateHistoryEntryId.description: The OCID of the last maintenance update history entry.

CloudVmClusterUpdate.description: The type used for update operations of the CloudVmCluster.

CloudVmClusterUpdateProperties.description: The updatable properties of the CloudVmCluster.

storageSizeInGbs.description: The data disk group size to be allocated in GBs per VM.

dataStorageSizeInTbs.description: The data disk group size to be allocated in TBs.

dbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The local node storage to be allocated in GBs.

memorySizeInGbs.description: The memory to be allocated in GBs.

cpuCoreCount.description: The number of CPU cores enabled on the cloud VM cluster.

ocpuCount.description: The number of OCPU cores to enable on the cloud VM cluster. Only 1 decimal place is allowed for the fractional part.

sshPublicKeys.description: The public key portion of one or more key pairs used for SSH access to the cloud VM cluster.

licenseModel.description: The Oracle license model that applies to the cloud VM cluster. The default is LICENSE_INCLUDED.

dataCollectionOptions.description: Indicates user preferences for the various diagnostic collection options for the VM cluster/Cloud VM cluster/VMBM DBCS.

computeNodes.description: The list of compute servers to be added to the cloud VM cluster.

email.description: The email address used by Oracle to send notifications regarding databases and infrastructure.

isDiagnosticsEventsEnabled.description: Indicates whether diagnostic collection is enabled for the VM cluster/Cloud VM cluster/VMBM DBCS.

isHealthMonitoringEnabled.description: Indicates whether health monitoring is enabled for the VM cluster / Cloud VM cluster / VMBM DBCS.

isIncidentLogsEnabled.description: Indicates whether incident logs and trace collection are enabled for the VM cluster / Cloud VM cluster / VMBM DBCS.

name.description: Name of the day of the week.

dbName.description: The database name. For the default DbPlan, the dbName is default.

flashCacheLimit.description: The flash cache limit for this database. This value is internally configured based on the share value assigned to the database.

share.description: The relative priority of this database.

DbNode.description: The DbNode resource belonging to vmCluster

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DbNodeListResult.description: The response of a DbNode list operation.

value.description: The DbNode items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DbNodeMaintenanceType.description: The type of database node maintenance.

additionalDetails.description: Additional information about the planned maintenance.

backupIpId.description: The OCID of the backup IP address associated with the database node.

backupVnic2Id.description: The OCID of the second backup VNIC.

backupVnicId.description: The OCID of the backup VNIC.

cpuCoreCount.description: The number of CPU cores enabled on the Db node.

dbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The allocated local node storage in GBs on the Db node.

dbServerId.description: The OCID of the Exacc Db server associated with the database node.

dbSystemId.description: The OCID of the DB system.

faultDomain.description: The name of the Fault Domain the instance is contained in.

hostIpId.description: The OCID of the host IP address associated with the database node.

hostname.description: The host name for the database node.

provisioningState.description: The current state of the database node.

maintenanceType.description: The type of database node maintenance.

memorySizeInGbs.description: The allocated memory in GBs on the Db node.

softwareStorageSizeInGb.description: The size (in GB) of the block storage volume allocation for the DB system. This attribute applies only for virtual machine DB systems.

timeCreated.description: The date and time that the database node was created.

timeMaintenanceWindowEnd.description: End date and time of maintenance window.

timeMaintenanceWindowStart.description: Start date and time of maintenance window.

vnic2Id.description: The OCID of the second VNIC.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DbServerListResult.description: The response of a DbServer list operation.

value.description: The DbServer items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

displayName.description: The name for the Db Server.

exadataInfrastructureId.description: The OCID of the Exadata infrastructure.

cpuCoreCount.description: The number of CPU cores enabled on the Db server.

dbServerPatchingDetails.description: dbServerPatching details of the Db server.

maxMemoryInGbs.description: The total memory available in GBs.

dbNodeStorageSizeInGbs.description: The allocated local node storage in GBs on the Db server.

vmClusterIds.description: The OCID of the VM Clusters associated with the Db server.

dbNodeIds.description: The OCID of the Db nodes associated with the Db server.

maxCpuCount.description: The total number of CPU cores available.

autonomousVmClusterIds.description: The list of OCIDs of the Autonomous VM Clusters associated with the Db server.

autonomousVirtualMachineIds.description: The list of OCIDs of the Autonomous Virtual Machines associated with the Db server.

maxDbNodeStorageInGbs.description: The total max dbNode storage in GBs.

memorySizeInGbs.description: The total memory size in GBs.

shape.description: The shape of the Db server. The shape determines the amount of CPU, storage, and memory resources available.

timeCreated.description: The date and time that the Db Server was created.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DbSystemShapeListResult.description: The response of a DbSystemShape list operation.

value.description: The DbSystemShape items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

shapeFamily.description: The family of the shape used for the DB system.

availableCoreCount.description: The maximum number of CPU cores that can be enabled on the DB system for this shape.

minimumCoreCount.description: The minimum number of CPU cores that can be enabled on the DB system for this shape.

runtimeMinimumCoreCount.description: The runtime minimum number of CPU cores that can be enabled on the DB system for this shape.

coreCountIncrement.description: The discrete number by which the CPU core count for this shape can be increased or decreased.

minStorageCount.description: The minimum number of Exadata storage servers available for the Exadata infrastructure.

maxStorageCount.description: The maximum number of Exadata storage servers available for the Exadata infrastructure.

availableDataStoragePerServerInTbs.description: The maximum data storage available per storage server for this shape. Only applicable to ExaCC Elastic shapes.

availableMemoryPerNodeInGbs.description: The maximum memory available per database node for this shape. Only applicable to ExaCC Elastic shapes.

availableDbNodePerNodeInGbs.description: The maximum Db Node storage available per database node for this shape. Only applicable to ExaCC Elastic shapes.

minCoreCountPerNode.description: The minimum number of CPU cores that can be enabled per node for this shape.

availableMemoryInGbs.description: The maximum memory that can be enabled for this shape.

minMemoryPerNodeInGbs.description: The minimum memory that need be allocated per node for this shape.

availableDbNodeStorageInGbs.description: The maximum Db Node storage that can be enabled for this shape.

minDbNodeStoragePerNodeInGbs.description: The minimum Db Node storage that need be allocated per node for this shape.

availableDataStorageInTbs.description: The maximum DATA storage that can be enabled for this shape.

minDataStorageInTbs.description: The minimum data storage that need be allocated for this shape.

minimumNodeCount.description: The minimum number of database nodes available for this shape.

maximumNodeCount.description: The maximum number of database nodes available for this shape.

availableCoreCountPerNode.description: The maximum number of CPU cores per database node that can be enabled for this shape. Only applicable to the flex Exadata shape and ExaCC Elastic shapes.

isProtected.description: A Boolean flag indicating whether or not parts of the resource are unable to be explicitly managed.

self.description: The canonical absolute URL of the resource.

serial.description: The current serial of the zone. As seen in the zone's SOA record.

version.description: Version is the never-repeating, totally-orderable, version of the zone, from which the serial field of the zone's SOA record is derived.

viewId.description: The OCID of the private view containing the zone. This value will be null for zones in the global DNS, which are publicly resolvable and not part of a private view.

zoneType.description: The type of the zone. Must be either PRIMARY or SECONDARY. SECONDARY is only supported for GLOBAL zones.

EstimatedPatchingTime.description: The estimated total time required in minutes for all patching operations (database server, storage server, and network switch patching).

estimatedDbServerPatchingTime.description: The estimated time required in minutes for database server patching.

estimatedNetworkSwitchesPatchingTime.description: The estimated time required in minutes for network switch patching.

estimatedStorageServerPatchingTime.description: The estimated time required in minutes for storage server patching.

totalEstimatedPatchingTime.description: The estimated total time required in minutes for all patching operations.

dbPlans.description: An array of IORM settings for all the database in the Exadata DB system.

lifecycleDetails.description: Additional information about the current lifecycleState.

provisioningState.description: The current state of IORM configuration for the Exadata DB system.

objective.description: The current value for the IORM objective. The default is AUTO.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

GiVersionListResult.description: The response of a GiVersion list operation.

value.description: The GiVersion items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

version.description: A valid Oracle Grid Infrastructure (GI) software version.

Location.description: Do not use. Model to support location based path

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.
The resource-specific properties for this resource.

timeScheduled.description: The date and time the maintenance run is scheduled to occur.

patchingStatus.description: The status of the patching operation.

targetDbServerVersion.description: The target software version for the database server patching operation.

targetStorageServerVersion.description: The target Cell version that is to be patched to.

patchingMode.description: Cloud Exadata infrastructure node patching method.

estimatedPatchingTime.description: The estimated total time required in minutes for all patching operations.

months.description: Months during the year when maintenance should be performed.

weeksOfMonth.description: Weeks during the month when maintenance should be performed. Weeks start on the 1st, 8th, 15th, and 22nd days of the month, and have a duration of 7 days. Weeks start and end based on calendar dates, not days of the week. For example, to allow maintenance during the 2nd week of the month (from the 8th day to the 14th day of the month), use the value 2. Maintenance cannot be scheduled for the fifth week of months that contain more than 28 days. Note that this parameter works in conjunction with the  daysOfWeek and hoursOfDay parameters to allow you to specify specific days of the week and hours that maintenance will be performed.

daysOfWeek.description: Days during the week when maintenance should be performed.

hoursOfDay.description: The window of hours during the day when maintenance should be performed. The window is a 4 hour slot. Valid values are - 0 - represents time slot 0:00 - 3:59 UTC - 4 - represents time slot 4:00 - 7:59 UTC - 8 - represents time slot 8:00 - 11:59 UTC - 12 - represents time slot 12:00 - 15:59 UTC - 16 - represents time slot 16:00 - 19:59 UTC - 20 - represents time slot 20:00 - 23:59 UTC

leadTimeInWeeks.description: Lead time window allows user to set a lead time to prepare for a down time. The lead time is in weeks and valid value is between 1 to 4.

patchingMode.description: Cloud Exadata infrastructure node patching method.

customActionTimeoutInMins.description: Determines the amount of time the system will wait before the start of each database server patching operation. Custom action timeout is in minutes and valid value is between 15 to 120 (inclusive).

isCustomActionTimeoutEnabled.description: If true, enables the configuration of a custom action timeout (waiting period) between database server patching operations.

name.description: Name of the month of the year.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

termUnit.description: Term Unit. P1Y, P3Y, etc, see Durations https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

saasSubscriptionStatus.description: Indicates the status of the Subscription.

value.description: The VirtualNetworkAddress items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

domain.description: Virtual network address fully qualified domain name.

lifecycleDetails.description: Additional information about the current lifecycle state of the application virtual IP (VIP) address.

timeAssigned.description: The date and time when the create operation for the application virtual IP (VIP) address completed.

VnetId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an ARM resource.
